error.signature: failed to solve: failed to compute cache key: failed to calculate checksum of ref
error.regex: failed to compute cache key.*failed to calculate checksum

verdict.summary: BuildKit failed to compute cache keys, usually because a COPY/ADD source path doesn't exist in the build context or is excluded by .dockerignore. Also occurs with corrupt BuildKit cache.

dead_ends.action: Running docker build with --no-cache to bypass the issue
dead_ends.why_fails: If the source file genuinely doesn't exist in the build context, skipping cache doesn't help. The COPY instruction will still fail.

dead_ends.action: Switching from BuildKit to legacy builder
dead_ends.why_fails: Legacy builder is deprecated and will be removed. It may give a different error message but the underlying issue (missing files) remains.

workarounds.action: Check .dockerignore to ensure required files are not excluded
workarounds.how:
cat .dockerignore
# Make sure the file referenced in COPY is not matched by any pattern.
# Common mistake: ignoring 'node_modules' also ignores 'node_modules/.package-lock.json' needed for npm ci

workarounds.action: Verify the build context includes the file and COPY path is relative to context root
workarounds.how:
# List files in build context:
docker build --progress=plain . 2>&1 | head
# COPY paths are relative to the build context, NOT the Dockerfile location.
# Use: COPY ./src ./app/src (relative to context root)

docker builder prune --all --force
# Or remove BuildKit cache directory:
# rm -rf ~/.local/share/docker/buildkit/

frequently_confused_with.distinction: COPY failed stat is the legacy builder error for missing files. BuildKit cache key error is the equivalent error in BuildKit with a different error message format.
